Reviews.Title: “bony beds”
Reviews.Author: tromba61
Reviews.Content: Wow, I've never had a hotel bed where I could feel the metal mattress frame, but there it was and a bit painful on one's ankle. Also, the iron would heat up but had no steam when filled with water. The taxi they called for us had was late and told us that they normally don't do short trips. The hotel also messed up our reservations. The good news: the desk person immediately called the taxi company and told them never to send that driver. She also comped us one night for the reservation problems. Airport shuttle is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and afforadable”
Reviews.Author: SSSS10
Reviews.Content: this place has a very nice breakfast, pool area, cleanliness and an okay staff. It is in a good location near the tram where you can go many different places in Miami. And it is also located very close to the Miami University Baseball Field. Which was the main purpose for my travel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not sure about the location”
Reviews.Author: IanC67
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best La Quinta's that I have stayed at. The management and staff work really hard to please. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel provided a small welcome pack of items such as a razor, toothpaste etc. Wi-Fi internet access is included as is the standard La Quinta breakfast. The location feels very remote from anything however I was only there for two days and on business so I may have missed shops/restaurants etc. The only negative is that once again my La Quinta Returns points have not registered. This is a nice hotel; I would stay again on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly, helpful staff. free airport shuttle, and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: For a short stay, I'd prefer to stay here rather than the Intercontinental Doral that is across the street. Good size rooms, quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for a business traveler, not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjshibata
Reviews.Content: If you do business around or near the Miami Int'l airport, you know there are many choices of where to stay. There are cheap motels for under $80/nite or the InterContinental and Doral for $250/nite and up. As a business traveler, I look for something in the middle. What hotel will give me the most for a room where I will only be sleeping? I don't need a fancy pool, a full restaurant, ocean view, or a gym. I'm not on vacation. What I do need is a clean room, with decent linens (not towels that feel like sandpaper), bathroom, AC, and TV that work, wireless internet that works, and staff that get my reservation right. Continental breakfast helps but is not absolutely necessary. Just decent coffee. The La Quinta airport West has what I need for about $100 to $125/nite depepnding on the time of year. The rooms are spacious, the location is good, and the service is reasonably good. The elevator is rickety and they are going through some rennovations at this time. It is noisy someitmes. But overall, I like the price for what I get. The only time I really got upset with this particular hotel was when the Super bowl was in Miami and they chanrged $400/nite Thurs to Sun. There are two other La Quinta's in the area called "North" and "east". I've stayed at both and would not go back to either. There is a strip shopping center accross the parking lot with shops, restaurants, and a gas station. If other area hotels that offer full breakfast are priced within 10% of the la Quinta, I will stay at those. But usually the price differential is more like 20% and for that amount of money I can go out to eat. Not a business hotel, but a hotel for a budget minded business travler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money. Nice and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: inakijav
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good service. Excellent breakfast. Hotel rooms were big. Bathroom OK. The bad points: one day we had no tables to seat and have breakfast. They have to add tables.

Reviews.Title: “Okay clean hotel close to MIA Airport”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: Stay at La Quinta Inn Miami Airport West 21-> 24 november 2011. The hotel is booked 90-95 procent by latinamericans, so not all employees in the hotel speaks well english. Room is clean (except under bed...but it is always the same in all hotels). It seems like the hotel is constantly beeing renovated, the couple of days we were there, they were painting the hallways. Parking is free. The pool is big, clean, but very cold. Overall an okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Them to Clean”
Reviews.Author: hanalei
Reviews.Content: When I returned to the room at 4 PM and discovered that housekeeping never came to make up the room or leave fresh towels, I called to complain. I was told that housekeeping was too busy that day to clean. And no, I could not have clean towels because everyone from housekeeping had left for the day. The elevator was not only filthy, but the safety inspection certificate had expired 6 months earlier. In the hallway by the elevator there was a waist-high pile of garbage. Food at the breakfast bar was inedible. The plumbing was loud and malfunctioning. In sum, a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “nooooooooo”
Reviews.Author: mlascaris
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump...I don't even know where to start, so I'll just make some points. The place stinks; the staff mostly do not speak or even understand English; the floors are filthy as in carpet stains, the elevator is beat up; the breakfast sucks, people keep sliding pizza delivery fliers under the doors all night long and the list goes on...

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: linda12843
Reviews.Content: I am a Returns Club member and was disappointed at check out when I could not get my AAA discount because my husband did not mention it when checking in. I was also disappointed with the breakfast choices. The coffee was the worst I have ever had, there were no pastries and only plain bagels. There was some canned fruit salad in a bowl for the fruit choices. The room was clean and recently refurbished but the television was on the side of the bed instead of in front of it so I could not see it while lying down next to my husband. The side door we entered had a very littered door mat and did not give you a very good feeling upon entering. We also heard planes all through the night.This is not one of your better La Quinta Inns.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: jilllori
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience. It was easy to find, easy to check in, the desk clerk was super friendly and knowledgeable, and the staff was not only tolerant of my dog but nice to him! We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGormans
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after two very bad hotel/motels in earlier weeks. This was a breathe of fresh air, nice breakfast, clean rooms, new and up to date. Service was good, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent bedroom, employees are very kindly...I strongly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: mramosz
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something not so good but I was wrong! The room is amazing, the front desk crew are very nice...they try to attend our needs...I recommend...I will stay there always when I go to Miami!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located airport hotel - Time for refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: supergaggle
Reviews.Content: All I can say is the property just squeaks by the three star rating, in terms of the condition of it's rooms and facilities. The rooms are quite spacious, but the furniture has seen better days. Very uncomfortable. The bathroom was grimy, period. You know when its time for refurbishment. It does have a lot going for it though, relative to its location. Ideally situated close to expressway's 826/836 with shopping a'plenty. The famous Dolphin mall is a ten minute drive, but if you want to shop at a traditional mall, try the Miami International Mall. Almost forgot to mention: Within walking distance is a Dunkin Donuts (Important!) and JC Bermudez park. The park itself has a track encompassing a small lake. Go for a jog or roller blade. At night you can bring the charcoal and steaks, cook your family a meal on one of it's public BBQ's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starman99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel twice on this trip; one night in each occasion when flying in/out of Miami. When flying into Miami we called the hotel and they sent their free shuttle to collect us from the airport. Check-in to the hotel was a breeze and we were in our room (#518) within minutes of arriving. The room was extremely spacious with a large bathroom, free fast in-room wifi and a large flat-screen TV. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. No on-site restaurant or bar but front desk recommended several all within easy walking distance. Recommend Doral Ale House on 87th Avenue â€“ we ate there for evening meals for both stays. Free complimentary breakfast â€“ basic but acceptable. Large swimming pool â€“ didnâ€™t get chance to use it during the first stay due to moving elsewhere first thing in the morning. Used the pool on the second visit before flying home - most enjoyable. Second visit also enjoyable, we stayed in room # 511 â€“ room specification as before. Hotel allowed us a free late check-out (and stored our bags) due to evening flight home and we used free hotel shuttle back to the airport. In summary, would strongly recommend this hotel for a one night stay especially if flying in/out of Miami. If planning to see Miami I believe this hotel is too far away from the sights so I think we would stay either near the beaches or central Miami.

Reviews.Title: “definetly the best la quinta in miami....”
Reviews.Author: venezuelancouple
Reviews.Content: we've been there a couple times last year if i'm not wrong maybe three times last year... we loved la quinta and we still do, but the prices are going up too fast... first time in march last year we paid 102$ not bad for this hotel... in fact is an excellent, excellent price. then in september went up to 118$ and now we're looking for a reservation online and is still going up 139$ plus tax, i guess... we're talking about more than 40$ more in a year and a half.... per night... i still don't know if we will be there this november... but stop those prices... in sunrise ft. lauderdale is still around 70$... great hotel, great staff, great location, the only con is the price actually... the breakfast area is cozy... and we love their breakfast....

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, well located, nice, my first option in Doral.”
Reviews.Author: MexTexTech
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks. I have stayed in several Hotels in Doral, commuting there every month for six months, I checked-in in several budget hotels around here. Nice and clean place, little better than other "La Quinta" places I have been. Never had a problem to park my rental car. Pros: Included breakfast is good. Small but decent Gym, nice outdoors. Close a walking, running park, cross the street from a shopping plaza, not far for most Doral and Medley destinations. Gas station at walking distance with good wine selection, not far from Walmart and good restaurants, MacDonals two blocks away (have to cross traffic roads). Internet service was reliable in my room located not far from Gym at first floor. Never used it but they have a mini-van perhaps providing some transportation. Coffe maker, Microwave and Chiller in my room. Cons: Too small fridge. Not very good if you spec to bring food. It is more like a chiller, some of my food spoiled. I was there 3 times while room was cleaned, and I never saw a vacuum cleaner. TV is old tube TV with basic cable. The biggest Suites at the end of every floor are bigger but not by much, you only gain a couch smal living place and more space, no more beds and same small fridge. Too bad the fridge is small, this is one of the best La Quinta I have stayed. Nice place, quiet street, good service. Not a resort but one of the best budget Hotels I have been in Doral, and I have been in few of them for my work, this would be my choice if I have to come back to this area again. Shop with time, prices vary and this is a good place to lodge so make your reservations and plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed LaQuinta Gold Member”
Reviews.Author: Refthimjrttu
Reviews.Content: Beware travelers that book through a 3rd party and not through LaQuinta. When I did it through Hotels.com it listed shuttle service. Well, I got off the plane at 10:30pm and after collecting my bags I called for a shuttle. They told me I had to take a taxi because shuttle service stopped at 11pm. Hour restrictions were not listed on hotels.com. I also check expedia, orbitz, etc...all the same. The room was $85 and ended up paying $25 for a cab...almost a third of the price! If I knew that, I would have stayed some where with late night shuttle service. Needless to say I was pissed when I checked in. To make matters worse they quoted me a rate of $69 at check-in for the inconvienance only to charge me full price for the room at check-out. I was told since the room was already paid at time of booking they could do nothing to honor the rate they told me. Really!?! Has the hotel never heard of a credit!?! Just because I booked it on Hotels.com doesn't mean LaQuinta isn't getting paid for the room. What a cop out and horrible customer service. The hotel was average at best. I've stayed at nicer LaQuintas for that price and have no intentions on going back...specially after I explained in an email to the Assistant Manager my grivances and got no response. Just think, this is how a Gold Member gets treated imagine how they will act with regular members or members at all! This experience made me question doing business any more with this company...as a company you don't tell me you are going to do something and not do it muchless twice in one stay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “one night stay wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDASIB
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful, The property is very nice & in a great location. Our room 108 was very quiet. We could hear a couple of planes, but we love aviation. Don't think it was noisy, we just heard a little plane noise. Great location, close to airport & great dinning

Reviews.Title: “Always there for me”
Reviews.Author: Simon R
Reviews.Content: This place is very convenient for me and I spend more nights here than in any other hotel/inn. This trip was only one night and I had forgotten to book but they found me a king for a very good rate. I always feel at home here and this time with my wife was no exception.The beds are firm and comfortable and even though it is in the flightpath for Miami International the thick glass eliminates any noise and you get a good nights's sleep. I would recommend this to anyone who has business or needs to go shopping in Miami and to anyone who needs a place as a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad...”
Reviews.Author: PilotEricB
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is in a nice, safe area west of the airport. There are plenty of food options within walking distance (brick oven pizza, Tony Roma's, etc.) However, the hotel sits almost directly under one of the approach paths for Miami International, so be prepared for a moderate amount of airplane noise during the day (a bit less at night.) Front desk staff is very friendly and professional, and let me borrow a cell phone charger from the many they have stored behind the front desk. A number of things could definitely be improved about the property. Hallway carpeting is badly stained. Worse yet, many room doors are badly beaten and dented (almost as if people have been beating on them with hammers.) My room itself was clean, but digital clock was broken, TV remote batteries were dead, and tub faucet dripped steadily. The hotel management states "if you can't give us a 10, let us know." I appreciate the commitment, but I really shouldn't have to complain to get my room to be right. A better program of regularly inspecting rooms and fixing them would please me more. The breakfast area was mobbed by large numbers of people every morning (not much can be done about that) but please - the selection is very poor (Corn Flakes or Froot Loops for cereal, waffles, hard boiled eggs, and bread items.) Healthier cereals, fruits, donuts should all be considered. Finally both my coworker and I were very disturbed by the extreme numbers of restaurant advertisements being pushed under our room doors daily. I travel extensively through the US and have never in my life seen a hotel this bad- amounting to 4 or 5 flyers per day. We ended up resorting to each shoving a towel in the crack under the room door just to prevent them from being shoved under. The hotel management alludes to the problem via a sign warning guests not to order food from any of these places. This really needs to stop. It is a major security issue to have random people wandering the hotel stuffing ads under doors. I almost have to wonder if a hotel employeeis being paid to look the other way as these are brought in. In conclusion, the hotel has some nice attributes and I believe it is probably the nicest of the 3 MIami airport locations, but issues need to be corrected.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AFFORDABLE STAY!”
Reviews.Author: akklkoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise. It was a decent hotel with friendly staff. The rooms were very spacious and the beds were WONDERFUL! The airport shuttle was prompt and our check-in was smooth and quick. We walked to an nearby resteraunt for dinner. We all slept wonderfully in the comfortable beds! The continental breakfast was average. The staff arranged for us to get a shuttle to the port for $10/person. Affordable accomodations and a great nights stay!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: harwickt07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 1/1/11. We booked this hotel because they said they have free service to port of Miami when we arrived they said they canceled that service. Check in was long because the card machine wasn't working. It was around 7pm and the guy said he was the only one working the hotel. When we got to the room there was NO light bulbs (meaning we had no light in our room besides from what was coming in from outside) we called the front desk they said they only had 2 light bulbs left and that we would have to come down and put the light bulbs in our self. We were going to order food but the phone books were from 1997 we called about 10 different places but their phone number was disconnected. The safety and evacuation brochure was last updated in 1999. The room smelled and was really hot the air conditioner did not work. We went to breakfast around 8am and most of the food was gone the girl that was supposed to refill it was nowhere to be found. The food we did have tasted horrible. We were supposed to stay here on our way back but we canceled it. My advice would be to stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: qpwo
Reviews.Content: Spacious and clean room, convenient location, interesting building architecture, decent breakfast, quiet although near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: DeuxCarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had an early flight and this hotel ticked all the boxes. The room was enormous, clean, functional and quiet. The receptionists were really helpful and informed us of the complimentary airport shuttle service, but when we explained we had a hire car to return,wasted no time in giving us perfect directions to where we needed to drop it off. All this without even asking! Cannot comment on internet access/in room entertainment as we didn't need it. We were leaving too early for breakfast (again complimentary) but cannot fault our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well located stopover in miami”
Reviews.Author: annbury
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the LaQuinta Airport West on our trip south to the BVI every year. For one, we can actually find the place, not easy in a huge and confusing city like Miami. Second, they take pets, and do not charge extra for our poodle. Third, it is near the airport and also near a terrific Spanish restaurant called Brisas in the mall next door. The rooms are fine with free wi fi and most mod cons. Breakfast is free and standard motel fare, and the service is excellent. They have a nice fitness room. Small complaints: toilet seats are loose and the one elevator on each side is often out of order. Otherwise a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good transit Airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravlinNole
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before my early flight to Aruba the next day. Nice tourist class hotel with friendly staff that was clean, quiet, comfortable with a great breakfast buffet before my morning flight out. I did not use any of the advertised amenities like pool or fitness center. My only complaints were it is a little far from the airport for an airport hotel (others are closer), but we're talking an extra 5 or 10 minutes or so. Also - too many handicap parking palces, so if you get there late, they tend to be all that's there. In all, I can recommend this as a great choice in inexpensive tourist class hotels near Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay at excellent rates”
Reviews.Author: zwabber
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms, excellent beds, great continental breakfast (incl eggs)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...but a bit far from Miami attractions”
Reviews.Author: hallomainz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta Inn & Suites for one night in March while I was attending the Ultra Music Fetival. I picked the hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and price. For the hotel itself I have praise only. My room was clean, spaceous with an interesting layout, perfectly comfortable bedding, fridge and microwave...and it was quiet despite the proximity to the airport...almost perfect. Staff was very friendly, pool area is beautiful, breakfast was good, too. The sorrounding area is safe and offers a wide variety of chain restaurants. I'd definitely come again. But...and this is not to ignore. If you consider the La Quinta as a base from which to explore Miami attractions, think again. Mapquest may tell you that it is only a 20 minute drive to the beach. But Miami traffic is really bad even on weekends. So expect to spend a considerable amount of time on the highway when getting to and from the hotel. Other than that...this place is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My own Adventure with my familia”
Reviews.Author: aoquendo47
Reviews.Content: great time great place but most of all great food and being with my family!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was worth staying”
Reviews.Author: leo_tanuj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the good one.Nice rooms and cooling arrangement.But ya there were some mosquitoes which troublea whole night.We got a complimentary buffet breakfast and it was really a nice one.The hotel staff also served us vry politely.Overall it was really a good experience staying there

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Miami with a car”
Reviews.Author: numbphoto
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 days with our dog. the room was excellent. hotel and property was super clean. about 30 minutes from south beach via toll road. you need a car to fully enjoy staying in miami anyway. great value for dog owners.

Reviews.Title: “Take careful note”
Reviews.Author: UkBonefish
Reviews.Content: Arrive at MIA between 11pm and 7am and you will need at taxi $10, as the shuttle bus does not run between these hours. So arrive late and leave early you can add $20 to your La Quinta room rate. If you are on a fixed budget I would shop around, unless all hotels in this bracket are poor. Hotel appeared tired and there was an unpleasant odour throughout. The staff on the late shift gave the impression of being extremely unhappy with their employment and their employers, to the point that I did wonder why they worked there at all. The breakfast was acceptable to a hungry person. The fire alarm went off all night, which I hope was not the norm, but might reflect on maintenance. On the plus side, I received an apology at check out and my room rate was reduced, which I was happy to pay, just to leave. If asked I would avoid La Quinta in future.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the airport pickup”
Reviews.Author: friendlyplanet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Quinta Airport West. I am a member of the La Quinta Returns program, and so stay at La Quinta's every few months. Hotel is clean with a nice pool, and decent breakfast. However, my stay was spoiled by having to wait a hour at the airport for a shuttle pickup. My flight landed at 10 pm, and I called the hotel for an airport pickup. However, no one answered the phone, no matter how long I let it ring. Finally, at 10:30pm, someone answered from the front desk, and told me the shuttle would be at the airport in 7 minutes. 25 minutes later, after several more calls, the shuttle turned up. Checking in, the front desk staff were slow and surly. And finally, everything near by for food were all shut by the time I got there. This hotel is pretty remote from anything- do not stay here unless you get a car.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the Planes”
Reviews.Author: nippa1
Reviews.Content: A typical La Quinta both modern and clean with generally friendly staff , although,our initial reception was somewhat personality-free. Being located 2 miles out from Miami Runway 08R means that, you may be woken from 5am by air traffic passing 600 feet above. At 2 miles most jets are increasing thrust to compensate for increased drag and a possible go-around not at idle as most laymen might think. You might have thought that the architects would have fitted double glazing to reduce the intrusive sound but they didn't. Personally I would not stay there again until the rooms are soundproofed. Room Rates seem high given the effects of the unenviable location.

Reviews.Title: “Transportation to hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: dutch74
Reviews.Content: This hotel near Miami International Airport is a nice place. It has a couple of restaurants nearby. The room was nice and plenty of space for a sink and room for bathroom. The bed was comfortable and spacious. My biggest complaint with the hotel was the shuttle service. One of the shuttles drove close to the curb at the airport and was picking up passengers, and of course, this shuttle was to the "other" La Quinta. Another La Quinta shuttle was always passing by at a higher rate of speed. The shuttles run only til 10pm, after that you need a taxi to get to the hotel. So $14 later, I got to the hotel. I told them my complaint, they didn't seem too interested. I later asked for a shuttle for the next morning, the front desk person said, "be here 10 minutes before the top of the hour and the shuttle leaves at the top of the hour." So, I think, no problem. Next morning, check out at 1045am for the 11 shuttle. I see the shuttle up front and the driver walking around. The front desk person told me to wait near the door, the shuttle would leave at 11. Well, before you know it, it is 11, then 1130 and 1145, the shuttle is still up front. The driver is having breakfast next door with a guy who is leaving for the airport at a later time. I had to catch a flight, so I called a shuttle to pick me up, another $25 to spend. Just made check in time for my flight to Newark. I would think if you pay a good amount of money for a room, you would at least get transportation to the airport which is only 10-15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: blondarella
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel for one night near the Miami airport and this fit the bill just fine. Room was clean and spacious. Planes fly over approaching the airport but the hotel is well insulated so it is not noisy. Breakfast is nothing special, but it was adequate. It is near a number of decent chain restaurants and has easy access to freeways although it is off the main drag. They offer packets of toiletries if you've forgotten something - we needed shaving cream and they had it. Staff at front desk was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “don't liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: paolo57
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night and I chose this hotel because I was very happy about with the La Quinta in Orlando. This hotel is not at the same level.In fact it is not very new and not very clean (we had some ants going on the bed and every where...). I asked for a wake upand they forgot to call me... I'd say that if you want to spend few money it's ok but don't expect too much !

Reviews.Title: “Could Use a Cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Neutron
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel late at night, after flying to Miami for a business meeting. The hotel is about 6 miles from the airport. There is a free hotel shuttle, but several colleagues got fed up waiting and took a cab (I had a rental car). When I got to the room my first impression was being pleasantly surprised. It was a large and fairly new looking room. It had a nice work desk, a recliner to sit in, and what felt like a comfortable bed. But...when I pulled down the covers to get into bed, the sheets were covered with small black hairs. It looked like they had not changed the sheets from the previous guest. The next morning when I got into the shower I noticed that the caulking in the shower was moldy. Nothing a decent cleaning and some bleach wouldn't fix, but it seems no one had done it for a while. The bathroom floor needed to be mopped as well. Most of the parking at the hotel is on the sides of the building, away from the main entrance. There are doors on the side of the building that will open with a room key. But the key readers were not working...in fact, it looked they had been ripped out. So someone wedged a rock between the door and the doorframe so it never closed. This may explain why I kept getting takeout menus from local restaurants slid under my door. The breakfast was pretty good. Nothing fancy, but it was decent. Would I stay here again...maybe. But there are numerous hotels in the area (like the InterContinental across the street) so you do have choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good - need a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the second time because I liked it in my last trip. The hotel is good, clean, and provides basic free breakfast & wired hi-speed Internet access. However, this time around, the jacuzzi and the weight machine are both out of order. Last time I stayed, the treadmill was also ut of order. The hotel needs to improve and keep up its facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Love2VacationMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two different nights, one night on our way to Curacao and one night on our way back home about a week later. The first night we were on the first floor in a room overlooking the pool. This room was very nice, everything was new and very clean. The shower was nice, with a shower-pic shower head and a curved shower curtain which made the shower seem very spacious. The continental breakfast had a lot of choices; a typical hotel breakfast with cold cereal, juice, fruit, yogurt, bagels, danish, waffles. The staff was very nice and helpful. The shuttle service to the airport was good, but the hotel is about a 15-20 minute ride to/from MIA International. The benefit to being a little further from the airport is less airplane noise. The only problem we had this first stay was that the internet service didn't work. The second night we were on the third floor and the condition of the room wasn't as good as the first stay. The ceiling above the toilet was peeling, and the entire floor smelled kind of musty. The room was very clean, and the internet service worked this time. We ate supper both times at the Tony Roma restaurant located about 6 blocks away. The food and service were excellent. The first night we walked both directions, but the second night the shuttle driver from the La Quinta was kind enough to offer us a ride. The driver said that if he wasn't busy going to the airport or helping behind the desk, he could give us a ride. We really appreciated the lift because the weather was COLD when we were there. Overall, it was a nice place, with nice employees. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this motel. It wasn't perfect, but it was clean and we felt very safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Maverick186
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every month on business. The price is very reasonable, the rooms are completely refurbished and are always clean. I would highly recommend this hotel. They have a free shuttle to the airport but be careful if you ask them to pick you up when you arrive. They have yet to remember to pick me up. If they forget, the hotel will actually pay for the taxi.
